data.title: Fun place to eat in Terre Haute
data.text: We've gone to J Gumbos several times, and I always enjoy going there. You can sit and eat, take it to go, or eat at the bar. If you haven't been they allow you to sample to find something that you like. I've heard from friends who frequent New Orleans and they've mentioned that this place isn't "true" authentic food, but we find it consistent and delicious every time we go.

data.title: Tasty
data.text: Been here twice, both times it was good. Most of my family like their meals too. It was good that they had some outdoor seating on the sidewalk because we had our dog with us.

data.title: Delicious, but just not very authentic
data.text:
Pretty good.... In my opinion, J. Gumbo's is not truly authentic Cajun cuisine. It is, however, very tasty, especially their ratatouille. That is a SUPERB choice for vegetarians (like me!) or anyone wanting to have a large bowl of food, but also following a diet.
They have sizable portions, they're a little pricey, but it's overall tasty and the staff is helpful and friendly.
Most notably, though, is the owner. His charisma practically runs the place all on its own!

data.title: Cajun gumbo
data.text: Love it, has a bar inside restaurant makes you feel like you are in Louisiana. Fast, friendly service and smiles to go around. Makes you want to come back again and again. From hot and spicy to mild, with a sample of your choice before you buy, a great deal.

data.title: Interesting ambiance, not so great food
data.text: This restaurant offers a very generic and bland  version of Cajun food. There are almost no choices for vegetarians. But the bar looks awesome. It's a fun place to hang out, but don't expect authentic  Louisiana cuisine

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Food is very good and reasonably priced. They are a quiet place to eat,relaxing,easy to talk and to be heard.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Great food and fair priced meet the owner and he has plans to grow the menu with fresh seafood. The also sell half orders on most items on the menu which if your doing lunch I would of just got a half order. I like spice so I had the hottest they had. No wait staff just a line to order your food.

data.title: Good food, service and atmosphere!
data.text: I walked to this restaurant, which is just a block down from the Candlewood Suites.  The storefront windows are dark so you don't get a true appreciation of the interior until you walk in.  It is a wide/deep establishment.  The staff was very pleasant, helpful and efficient.  They do sell alcoholic beverages.  The prices were very reasonable and the portions more than ample.  Food was served in a ceramic dinner bowl with "real" utensils!

data.title: great decor
data.text: Eating here was interesting - apparently they have recently remodeled and the decor is so French Quarter! The food was good and it's cheap. Highly recommend.

data.title: Poor service, food not good!
data.text: I went to dinner with some other business associates at this newer restaurant.  They have a bar there if you want to have a cocktail with dinner; however, the bar is only open on certain days of the week.  The food was not very good and the selection was average at best.  I would not go back.

data.title: Great Cajun Food with fun Bourbon Street Decor and a Newly Added Bar
data.text: Really good fast food from N'awlins based menu. You can get it to go or stay and enjoy the uniquely decorated interior that looks like the French Quarter. The newly opened bar is fun and festive with an almost Disney-esque decor. A very unique place.

data.title: Not bad for Terre Haute
data.text: Ate dinner here one evening.  Since I'm from the Gulf Coast, I'm pretty familiar with Cajun and Creole food.  I ordered the gumbo and the red beans and rice.  The gumbo was good, but it really didn't taste like gumbo I'm familiar with.  That being said, it tasted fine - just like a completely different dish.  I thought the red beans and rice were really good and tasted like "real" red beans and rice.  Nice atmosphere inside.  If I'm in town again, I'd definitely go back.

data.title: Bubblegutz
data.text: Allow me to start with something positive, The lady that waited on us was GREAT, HELPFUL and Positive, But as I read the review “Great Food” and “Consistently good cajun food”  I decided to give J. Gumbo’s a try as my wife and I drove the 45 min to get there. Now as I was eating this rice version of S.O.S, they called "Chicken red hot" the only thing I could think of  was “Why did I waist a meal on this”  The food was hot! (spicy} but was a little warmer than room temperature. And at the old (Wabash Ave) location all of there dished screamed of meat, now your screaming at your bowl “Where is the meat?? the chicken red hot was more red hot sauce then chicken which made our ride home after the meal a test of wills to not (“splod”) I’ve eaten spicy foods from all over the country and cajun from the best this is spicy, but a chain store version of what cajun could be. Thanks J. Gumbo’s but I’ll be one and done

data.title: Consistently good cajun food.
data.text: Although it is a chain, it offers a type of food which is a welcome change from burgers and chicken sandwiches.  Food is always good.  Popular spot for students.

data.title: Fun place, good food, nice staff
data.text: We love J. Gumbo's for something a little different.  Portions are good sized, food is always tasty.  Be sure to ask for a sample if you aren't sure you like something.  They recently added a bar, so we can now get a cocktail to go with our Cajun food.  Great atmosphere, staff is always very nice, the owner is usually around somewhere close and he's a very personable guy!

data.title: Great food in a cool setting
data.text: First visit was awesome, shocked that the place was all but empty though. The staff was amazing in helping us pick the perfect meal, gave samples of everything.  Sat in the OK Bayou bar and ate. Server was really nice and attentive. Will definitely be back!! Owners need to advertise this place better.

data.title: Clean, Nice decor, pre-packaged food
data.text: The service was excellent,  Very nice staff.  Offered samples of all the different options to taste before ordering.  The food was ok, not authentic by any means.  While we were being served the assistant manager came out to the food line with pre-packaged/reheated food and poured it into the pot on the line.  Nothing seemed to be actually prepared there, only reheated.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Local place, good food. Not 100% authentic but you can't expect that far from Louisiana! Food is good though, employees always friendly. Clean restaurant, fun environment. Very busy during lunch hour.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text:
The staff made sure that we had the opportunity to taste each of the menu options prior to ordering our food. 

New Orleans quisine.  The food was excellent and the prices were great! 

Definitely recommend and will return when in the area.

data.title: Cajun Country of the Midwest
data.text: Ambiance is fabulous, food is fantastic (even if spicy). Great place to meet friends and family. You feel like you are in a section of New Orleans French Quarter on Wabash Avenue!
